title: Who is Humble and Meek? | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 1.43 | 22.07.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: O Krishna, maintainer of the people, I have heard by disciplined succession that those who destroy family traditions dwell always in hell.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada reads and translates Bhagavad Gita verse 1.43, emphasizing the consequences of destroying family traditions.

segments.key_quote: So unless the human society accepts that, these principles of varnasana-dharma, ordained by Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Lord, is not considered amongst the human beings. They are as good as animals, because there is no regular, systematic principles.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the importance of family tradition and varnasrama dharma for human society, contrasting it with animalistic existence.

segments.key_quote: So Caitanya Mahāprabhu inquired, what is the actual aim of life? Sādhya-sādhana. Sādhya and sādhana. What is the aim?
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada introduces the concept of Sadhya-Sadhana (goal and means) and mentions Caitanya Mahaprabhu's inquiry about the aim of life.

segments.key_quote: Why this living entity is wandering, not fixed up? So there must be some goal. He is hankering after that. There must be some goal of life.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada critiques Darwin's theory, emphasizing the lack of understanding of the goal of life and the transmigration of the soul.

segments.key_quote: But this is the Vedic principle. Even Caitanya Mahāprabhu, he, when he was asked by Prakāśananda Sarasvati, that you are a sannyāsī, you do not engage yourself in the study of Vedānta.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada contrasts modern opinions with Vedic principles, highlighting Caitanya Mahaprabhu's humility when questioned about his practices.

segments.key_quote: So Caitanya Mahāprabhu replied, yes, my Guru Mahārāja, spiritual master, saw me a fool number one.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes the importance of humility, citing Caitanya Mahaprabhu's example and verses from Caitanya Caritamrita about considering oneself lower than a worm in stool.

segments.key_quote: Everyone should think that, I am a pig, what is my value? That is really large. Humble and meek.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada continues to stress humility, stating that one should always consider oneself a fool and avoid giving personal opinions without authoritative support, referencing Arjuna's example.

segments.key_quote: So Rāmānanda Rāya said, that, the real purpose of life, goal of life, is to satisfy the Supreme Personality of God.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that the aim of life is to satisfy Krishna, drawing an analogy to citizens satisfying their government.

segments.key_quote: In each planet, there is government, there is authority, and above all of them, there is the supreme authority, Krishna.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada asserts Krishna as the supreme authority over all universes and planets, with Brahma as a manager of each universe.

segments.key_quote: The difference is a good citizen is always trying to satisfy the government of the supreme God, Krishna.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the shape of the world according to Vedic scriptures and reiterates the importance of satisfying Krishna as the supreme governor.

segments.key_quote: Therefore our business is to satisfy Krishna, to become perfect. Satisfy Krishna.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes that the universes are Krishna's kingdom and that our primary business is to satisfy Him to achieve perfection.

segments.key_quote: One who wants to satisfy Vishnu is called Vaiṣṇava. That is Vaiṣṇava.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada defines a Vaishnava as one who wants to satisfy Vishnu and stresses the responsibility of human life to avoid becoming like cats, dogs, or irresponsible hippies.

segments.key_quote: For human being, it is the duty to understand his position, and it is his duty to satisfy the Supreme Lord, Vishnu. This is the whole plan.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada describes the destruction of family life and the duty of humans to satisfy Vishnu, mentioning the initiation of Brahmanas to become Vaishnavas for deity worship.

segments.key_quote: He agrees to accept our offering just on the basis of love. The Vaishnava loves Vishnu and Vishnu agrees to accept any foodstuff.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that Vishnu accepts offerings based on love and bhakti, emphasizing that a Vaishnava leads a regulated life aimed at satisfying Vishnu.

segments.key_quote: In the human life, if they do not follow the regulative principles of family life, family tradition and systematic arrangement of four division of the society... In this way, we can satisfy the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the importance of following regulative principles, family traditions, and jati-dharma (duties based on birth) to satisfy the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: Our only tradition is how to satisfy Visnava. That is the tradition of everyone. But especially our Visnava. They must be very alert, very careful how to keep Lord Visnava, Krsna satisfied.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes the importance of maintaining family traditions and especially the Visnava's kula-dharma, which is to satisfy Visnu.

segments.key_quote: In the manuṣana, actually human life begins, when he's ready to serve the Supreme Lord, Visnu. That is human life.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that human life begins when one is ready to serve Visnu, contrasting it with animalistic existence and emphasizing the need to control the senses.

segments.key_quote: That means to control the senses means to engage the senses in the service of the Lord. This is control.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that true control of the senses comes from engaging them in the service of the Lord, contrasting it with artificial methods and emphasizing bhakti.

segments.key_quote: So if you want to live like human beings, manushyana, then this system must be karyatā puruṣiṇa-paraptam āyata-manjmaya-sviṣṭhaṁ dhuna-gana-vihāgya, then society must be divided into four classes.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes that to live like human beings, society must be divided into four classes according to varnasrama dharma.

segments.key_quote: Purpose is, you put yourself, you live like a cat and dog, you live like a human being, if you do not follow the process, the varnasam-dharmāna society, ussanya-kula-dharmana, manusyana, janardana, narake niyatam, niyatam means always, here you have no, just like the hellish life.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada concludes by warning against living like cats and dogs, emphasizing the importance of following varnasrama dharma and family traditions to avoid a hellish life.
